Narrative_Structure: Small doubt or discomfort -> Guided trial (micro‑action) -> Noticed benefit -> Quiet integration

Name: Reflection -> Reframing -> Integration
Narrative_Structure: Stuck thought -> Recontextualization -> Acceptance/Integration -> Stabilized adjustment

Name: Support and Recovery
Narrative_Structure: Mild distress -> Concrete help -> Initiative resumes -> Confidence regained

Name: Learning through Observation
Narrative_Structure: Observe others -> Identify -> Personal application -> Consolidation

Name: If‑Then Intent Setting
Narrative_Structure: Cue -> If‑then plan -> Application -> Stabilization

Name: Habit Stacking (gentle)
Narrative_Structure: Existing habit -> Add micro‑action -> Short repetition -> Anchoring

Name: Light Accountability (supportive peer)
Narrative_Structure: Simple agreement -> Brief check‑in -> Adjustment -> Maintenance

Name: Conversational De‑escalation
Narrative_Structure: Tension cue -> Pause/name -> Rephrase -> Calm closure

Name: Express Decision Hygiene
Narrative_Structure: Key question -> Max 2 options -> Simple choice -> Quick review

Name: Environment Redesign
Narrative_Structure: Visual cue -> Small context change -> Trial -> Stabilization

Name: Recovery after Lapse
Narrative_Structure: Minor lapse -> Normalize -> Micro‑correction -> Back to routine

Name: Micro‑celebration -> Consolidation
Narrative_Structure: Small success -> Name/validate -> Repeat -> Anchor

Name: Gentle Re‑attribution
Narrative_Structure: Harsh interpretation -> Gentle causal reframing -> Adjustment -> Relief

Name: 90‑Second Attention Reset
Narrative_Structure: Interruption -> Breathe/stretch -> Refocus -> Smooth resume

Name: Dramatic Arc (Freytag Pyramid) (long)
Narrative_Structure: Exposition -> Rising Action -> Climax -> Falling Action -> Denouement

Name: Three-Act Structure (Aristotelian) (long)
Narrative_Structure: Setup -> Confrontation -> Resolution

Name: Hero’s Journey (Campbell/Vogler) (long)
Narrative_Structure: Call -> Trials -> Ordeal/Death -> Revelation -> Return (transformed)

Name: Story Circle (Dan Harmon) (long)
Narrative_Structure: You -> Need -> Go -> Search -> Find -> Take -> Return -> Change

Name: Save the Cat (Beat Sheet – compact) (long)
Narrative_Structure: Setup -> Catalyst -> Debate -> Break‑Into‑2 -> Midpoint -> Bad‑to‑Worse -> Break‑Into‑3 -> Finale

Name: Fichtean Curve (Chain of Crises) (long)
Narrative_Structure: Incident -> Crisis₁ -> Crisis₂ -> Crisis₃ -> Climax -> Aftermath

Name: Seven‑Point Plot (long)
Narrative_Structure: Hook -> First Plot Pt -> First Pinch -> Midpoint -> Second Pinch -> Second Plot Pt -> Resolution

Name: Kishōtenketsu (non‑conflict) (long)
Narrative_Structure: Ki (intro) -> Shō (development) -> Ten (twist) -> Ketsu (synthesis)

Name: Rags‑to‑Riches (Ascending Arc) (long)
Narrative_Structure: Lack -> Opportunity -> Trials -> Breakthrough -> Reward/Stability

Name: Voyage‑and‑Return (long)
Narrative_Structure: Ordinary World -> Departure -> Strange World -> Ordeal -> Return (lessons kept)

Name: Tragedy (Fall) (long)
Narrative_Structure: Promise -> Hubris/Flaw -> Reversal -> Catastrophe -> Aftermath

Name: Branching Case (Interactive/Advice) (long)
Narrative_Structure: Setup -> Decision between {Path A or Path B} -> End

Name: Story Spine (Pixar/Kenn Adams) (long)
Narrative_Structure: Once upon a time… -> Every day… -> But/One day… -> Because of that… (x2+) -> Until finally… -> Ever since then…

Name: Overcoming the Problem (Booker—softened) (long)
Narrative_Structure: Concrete problem -> Diagnosis -> Simple plan -> Implementation -> Evaluation -> Stabilization

Name: The Quest (Booker) (long)
Narrative_Structure: Call to quest -> Journey & trials -> Approach/Ordeal -> Goal achieved -> Return & lesson

Name: Comedy (Booker) (long)
Narrative_Structure: Misunderstandings/Confusion -> Complications -> Revelations/Recognitions -> Union/Resolution

Name: Rebirth (Booker) (long)
Narrative_Structure: Enchantment/Stagnation -> Lowest point -> Empathy trigger -> Transformation -> Renewal

Name: Whodunit / Mystery (long)
Narrative_Structure: Crime/mystery -> Investigation (clues & red herrings) -> Revelation (unmasking) -> Denouement

Name: Story Grid — Five Commandments (long)
Narrative_Structure: Inciting Incident -> Progressive Complications -> Crisis -> Climax -> Resolution

Name: Dan Wells — Seven‑Point (long)
Narrative_Structure: Hook -> Plot Turn 1 -> Pinch 1 -> Midpoint -> Pinch 2 -> Plot Turn 2 -> Resolution

Name: 27‑Chapter Method (Kat O’Keeffe) (long)
Narrative_Structure: Act I (9 blocks) -> Act II (9 blocks) -> Act III (9 blocks) — 3×9 chapter progression

Name: Aristotle’s Poetics (complex plot) (long)
Narrative_Structure: Setup/Complication -> Peripeteia (reversal) + Anagnorisis (recognition) -> Resolution

Name: Heroine’s Journey (Murdock) (long)
Narrative_Structure: Separation from the feminine -> Identification with the masculine -> Trials -> Illusion of success/aridity -> Re‑integration/Union

Name: Romancing the Beat (Gwen Hayes) (long)
Narrative_Structure: Setup -> Internal/external complications -> Crisis/Risk of breakup -> HEA/HFN

Name: Snowflake Method (Ingermanson) (long)
Narrative_Structure: One sentence -> One paragraph -> Character sheets -> One page per character -> Four‑page plot -> Scene lists (iterative)

Name: Story Genius (Lisa Cron) (long)
Narrative_Structure: Inside outline: causal backstory -> Inner need -> Scene chain cause->effect -> POV & theme made explicit

Name: Thematic Square (Robert McKee) (long)
Narrative_Structure: Value -> Contrary -> Contradictory -> Negation of the negation

Name: Five‑Act Structure (long)
Narrative_Structure: Exposition -> Rising Action -> Climax -> Falling Action -> Denouement

Name: In medias res (long)
Narrative_Structure: Start in the middle of the action -> Fill in backstory (flashbacks/dialogue) -> Rising action -> Climax -> Resolution

Name: Adventure Arc (long)
Narrative_Structure: Ordinary world -> Departure into unstable world -> Sequence of escalating obstacles -> Survival/escape/resolution -> Return or open ending

Name: Chase Arc (long)
Narrative_Structure: Threat appears -> Flight -> Alternating pursuit cycles -> Close call or reversal -> Capture or escape resolution

Name: Rescue Arc (long)
Narrative_Structure: Victim captured -> Discovery -> Quest toward antagonist -> Confrontation -> Liberation (or failure)

Name: Escape Arc (long)
Narrative_Structure: Unjust captivity -> Failed attempts -> Ingenuity/ally support -> Breakout -> Pursuit aftermath or freedom

Name: Revenge Arc (long)
Narrative_Structure: Initial harm -> Moral shock/decision -> Preparation and escalation -> Confrontation -> Retribution or moral collapse

Name: Enigma/Mystery Arc (long)
Narrative_Structure: Unknown phenomenon -> Clues collected -> False leads and revelations -> Core discovery -> Explanation/resolution

Name: Rivalry Arc (long)
Narrative_Structure: Two forces introduced -> Competition escalates -> Retaliations/strategic shifts -> Decisive confrontation -> Victory

Name: Outsider Arc (long)
Narrative_Structure: Disadvantaged protagonist -> Social or systemic resistance -> Small breakthroughs -> Major proving test -> Recognition or dignified failure

Name: Temptation Arc (long)
Narrative_Structure: Desire or forbidden lure -> Internal conflict -> Yielding or resisting -> Consequences -> Reassessment/transformation

Name: Sacrifice Arc (long)
Narrative_Structure: Rising stakes -> Moral dilemma -> Costly choice -> Self-sacrifice -> Restoration or tragic consequence
